meanings.definition: Taking a general view of a subject; summary or condensed.
meanings.sent1: The teacher provided a synoptic overview of the chapter to help the students understand better.
meanings.sent2: The report offered a synoptic analysis of the market trends for the investors.
meanings.sent3: The synoptic explanation of the complex theory made everyone laugh at its simplicity.
meanings.sent4: Her synoptic approach to problem-solving was like a bright light in the dark room of confusion.
meanings.sent5: The synoptic image of the city skyline stayed vividly in his mind.

meanings.sent1: The synoptic summary at the beginning of the book helped readers grasp the main points quickly.
meanings.sent2: She wrote a synoptic review of the movie, highlighting its key elements.
meanings.sent3: The synoptic nature of the document made it easy to understand even for beginners.
meanings.sent4: His speech had a synoptic quality that captured the essence of the issue.
meanings.sent5: The synoptic outline of the project plan was clear and organized.

meanings.sent1: I read the synoptic of the novel to decide if I wanted to read the whole book.
meanings.sent2: The professor asked the students to write a synoptic of the research paper.
meanings.sent3: The synoptic was so brief that it left out important details, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: The synoptic served as a roadmap for the presentation, guiding the speaker through key points.
meanings.sent5: The synoptic of the play gave a quick overview of the plot.
